intro: Chamaesaracha heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf chamaesaracha, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often lobed leaves that vary in shape depending on environmental conditions. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique foliage and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
